title.narrative: Soins de santé d'urgence aux personnes déplacées et aux populations d'accueil touchées par la crise nigériane dans la région du Lac au Tchad

description.narrative: The main objective of this joint health project between WHO, UNICEF and UNFPA is to provide access to healthcare for 66,000 people in the Lake Region, to contribute to reducing morbidity and mortality rates, especially among children and women. The three UN agencies will use CERF funds to provide medicines and supplies to 14 health centres, conduct emergency vaccinations to increase the coverage rate from 55 to 80 per cent, support four mobile clinics, and provide maternal healthcare. Some 66,000 people (58,000 IDPs and 8,000 from host communities and other affected people) will benefit from the project, which will be implemented within six months.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Soins de santé d'urgence aux personnes déplacées et aux populations d'accueil touchées par la crise nigériane dans la région du Lac au Tchad

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS CHAD RAPID RESPONSE POST-CONFLICT NEEDS 2016

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
